node.title: 'It's unfair': The millionaires who want to pay more tax
node.description: House prices and the share market have ballooned, but wages are barely growing — a combination widening the gap between those who make money from assets and those who make it from labour.
node.content:
["House prices and the value of the\u00a0share market have ballooned. But wages are barely growing.", "The combination means a widening gap between those who make their money from assets and those who make it from their labour \u2013 a situation even some of the beneficiaries think needs to change.", "\"I think it's unfair,\" said Rob Pallin, sitting on the deck of his house. \"It's unfair that I get\u00a0these tax breaks that a younger person cannot get because they're just earning a wage\".", "The chair of retailer Paddy Pallin is unhappy with how his income gets treated.", "\"It's totally unfair that just because someone's well off they can afford a good accountant and a good lawyer and adjust things and not pay their fair share of tax,\" he said.", "\"There are so many ways: you invest in certain shares, for instance, you get franking credits. There's capital gains, a whole lot of things.\"", "The pandemic has pumped the value of assets. Australian house prices are now 19 per cent higher than they were before the pandemic and jumped an astonishing $52,600 in just the June quarter.", "The ASX 200 index, charting the value of Australia's biggest 200 companies, is 24 per cent higher than this time last year, and more than 42 per cent up in the past 5 years.", "Meanwhile, wage growth is only 1.7 per cent this year and been weak for almost a decade. Treasury predicts there will be more pressure on people because their purchasing power \u2013 what they can get for their money \u2013 is sliding backwards.", "Anna Langford is studying, volunteering, and working in hospitality and retail.", "", "
Wage-earner Anna Langford thinks young people are not getting a fair deal.(ABC News: Michael Barnett)
", "\"So yeah, it's not unusual for young people to be juggling multiple things just to kind of be able to make it all work living out of home,\" she said.", "But the way her income is treated compared to Rob's is vastly different. For Anna and her friends, the idea of building financial security or buying a house seems very far off.", "\"Oh, yeah, absolutely,\" she said, smiling.", "Economist Saul Eslake predicts the latest census will show the home ownership rate of young adults, aged from 20 to their mid-30s, will be at its lowest point since 1950.", "
Wages vs Income
", "The gap between people who earn their income from assets \u2013 like property, superannuation and shares \u2013 and those who earn income from their work is concerning economists and tax experts.", "\"Incrementally, different forms of savings have been set to be taxed at different rates,\" said Kristen Sobeck, senior research officer at the Tax and Transfer Policy Institute of ANU's Crawford School of Public Policy.", "Dr Angela Jackson of Equity Economics points to the end of state-based wealth taxes in the 1970s as a starting point for Australia relying more heavily on income taxes. When Prime Minister John Howard discounted capital gains tax by 50 per cent, experts say it super-charged the attractiveness of asset income.", "", "
Dr Angela Jackson is lead economist at Equity Economics. She's worried about widening inequality and the tax burden on workers.(ABC News: Peter Healy)
", "\"And what we've seen that do really over time is underpin this huge generation of wealth in Australia and asset wealth, while at the same time incomes have remained relatively flat,\" she said.", "\"And that's created greater inequality in terms of wealth over time and created this disproportionate reliance in our system on income taxes versus wealth taxes, and capital income taxes.\"", "Recent elections have been dogged by rumours about the reintroduction of a death tax, but no major parties are currently proposing inheritance or wealth taxes.", "
Already taxed once
", "People like Mr Pallin, Dr Jackson noted, have\u00a0benefited\u00a0from a lot of different tax policies over time, \"that have helped him generate that wealth alongside his effort\".", "It's important to remember Mr Pallin's income has already been taxed once \u2013 when he earned it.", "But converted to assets, the income he earns gets tax advantages that include:", "While these tax concessions are available to all income-earners, some economists argue that the benefits disproportionately benefit the rich.", "\"The sorts of investments that I've got my money into, I\u00a0have a better tax dealings than someone who's just earning a straight wage,\" Mr Pallin said.", "With only work providing her with income, Ms Langford doesn't enjoy those advantages.", "\"I had to look at what franking credits were!\" she said.", "(Labor took a policy curbing franking credits to the 2019 election. It has since dumped the policy).", "
Millionaires want to pay
", "But some millionaires want to pay more tax \u2013 to reduce inequality and pay to fix society's biggest problems.", "\"I can tell you I'm not spending more money when I'm getting richer and richer and richer,\" said Djaffar Shalchi, an entrepreneur from Denmark.", "\"I eat three times a day I have to have clothes and so on, but the wealth is just accumulated. And we can see that the last four decades it has been extreme.", "\"Under COVID, it has opened everybody's eyes that something has to address that problem.\"", "The founder of Millionaires for Humanity, a network of wealthy people who advocate for raising taxes on wealthy people, he points to Norway \u2013 which has long had a wealth tax \u2013 and newly-passed imposts in Argentina and Bolivia.", "Pointing to the trillions of dollars of investment needed to prevent global warming beyond 1.5 degrees, Mr Shalchi urged voters to push for change.", "Given any tax on extreme wealth would only hit a tiny, highly-secure percentage of the population, it's not surprising the group's polling in Australia found broad support for the concept.", "\"The one per cent, the top\u00a00.1 per cent has enormous lobbying power in our governments, across countries,\" Mr Shalchi said.", "\"They are really pushing hard not to get taxed. So we need people to go vote for politicians who have the courage to do that.\"", "
Inequality rising
", "The most substantial change to our tax system in recent decades was the introduction of the goods and services tax (GST) two decades ago.\u00a0", "One of the reasons tax reform is difficult is that rules creates groups of beneficiaries who will then campaign against changes to it.", "\"Once people have had a benefit, it's very hard to take it off them,\" said Dr Mark Zirnsak, spokesperson for advocacy group Tax Justice Network Australia.", "\"I think it becomes it's an even bigger problem where it's the wealthy who have got the benefit, because they have more political clout in our society.\"", "", "
Mark Zirnsak analysed the common reporting standard data released by the ATO.(Supplied: Uniting Church in Australia)
", "Dr Zirnsak would like to see the tax system become more progressive, and opposed recent tax cuts to personal income tax that he believed favoured wealthy people.", "\"The justification for higher taxes on the rich, it's not about 'soak the rich' it's actually about people who are doing well are generally benefiting from the system that's been set up.\" he said.", "\"So it's not unreasonable to say if you're benefiting enormously from a system that's skewed to your interests, you should have a more vested stake in actually funding that system.\"", "
Change possible
", "Dr Jackson of Equity Economics said that young people will pay more, over time. Without parental assistance or tapping the so-called 'Bank of Mum and Dad', they will struggle to enter the housing market. Without that asset they'll be paying tax on income.", "\"So what will happen is there'll be an even greater imposition on workers. People with labour income\u00a0are going to have to pay more as a percentage of their overall income to support the services that we need,\" she said.", "But change could be forced upon us by the COVID crisis, which meant governments spent billions of dollars as profitable sectors of the economy were shut down to stop the spread.", "\"The ageing of the population, in addition to this massive debt that we've accumulated as a result of COVID-19, will hopefully bring an impetus to spark the need for what we've there's been a need for tax reform for decades now,\" said Kristen Sobeck, from the Crawford School of Public Policy.", "", "
Rob Pallin says he gets preferential treatment by the tax system, with younger and poorer people paying more and not getting the same benefits.(ABC News:\u00a0John Gunn)
", "At his house in the forest, Mr Pallin\u00a0just wants the advantages he has to be better shared with people like Ms Langford.", "\"I think we've got to be far more equitable in how we treat people,\" he said."]
